ref: 9124 baṇḍá ʻ maimed (in hands, feet or tail) ʼ AV., ʻ impotent ʼ ŚrS.com. 2. *baṇḍha -- . 3. *baḍu -- (cf. baṭu -- ). 4. *baḍḍu -- . 5. *baḍḍhu -- . 6. *bāḍa -- . 7. *bāṇṭa -- . [Scarcely with P. Tedesco JAOS 65, 86 < vr̥ddha<-> ʻ cut ʼ, but one of a series of words with initial labial expressing a defect of body, mind or character, whether of Mu. (PMWS 95) or Drav. origin (T. Burrow BSOAS xii 387): cf. paṇḍá -- , *phaṇṭa -- , *bhaṇḍu -- , vaṇṭa -- 2. Of these at least vaṇṭa -- 2 is poss. an IA. deformation of Indo -- ir. *vanta -- in Khot. vanda ʻ short ʼ, Bal. gwand, Par. &omacrtodtod IIFL i 256 (cf. kuṇṭha -- ~ Pers. kund) associated with similar Mu. or Drav. words. -- Full list of ʻ defective ʼ words with initial b -- and bh<-> s.v. *bukka -- 4. Similar series s.vv. kuṇṭha -- , *ṭuṇṭa -- 2, *naṭṭa -- , phakka -- , maṭṭa -- , *rakka -- , *lakka -- 1, *śaṭṭa -- ]
Ku. bāno ʻ different from its proper kind ʼ;
A. bã̄ri ʻ widow ʼ, bariyā ʻ widow's illegitimate son ʼ;
B. bã̄ṛā ʻ penis ʼ, bã̄ṛiyā, bẽṛe ʻ tailless ʼ;
Bi. bã̄ṛ ʻ old dry bed of a river, blighted and grainless head of small millet, bullock with broken tail (= baṇḍā) ʼ;
H. bã̄ṛ ʻ tailless, docked ʼ, bã̄ṛā m. ʻ a tailless or docked animal ʼ, bã̄ḍā ʻ maimed, crippled ʼ;
G. bã̄ḍũ ʻ tailless ʼ, bã̄ḍiyɔ ʻ contemptuous term for a Moslem (because circumcised) ʼ;
M. bã̄ḍ ʻ shrunken or diminished from blight, stout and lusty (of person), coarse (of cloth), seditious ʼ, m. ʻ stalk of blasted corn ʼ, n. ʻ field of such ʼ.
